UMass: Chemist in state lab scandal lied on resume

Former state chemist Annie Dookhan does not have a master’s degree in chemistry from UMass Boston as she claims on her resume, officials confirm. (Globe, 3:26 p.m.)

The state Democratic Party claims a video it shot shows at least two GOP staffers making tomahawk chops and whoops mocking Elizabeth Warren. (Globe, 12:56 p.m.)

Warren aided mining firm

In the 1990s, Elizabeth Warren helped LTV Steel fight a congressional requirement that it pay millions into a fund for its retired coal miners’ health care.

Mindy Kaling’s mother inspired her new TV show

On the day the actress found out “The Mindy Project” had been picked up by Fox, her mother, whose years as an ob/gyn helped inspire the show, died of cancer.
Opinion | Christopher L. Gasper

We have reached the tipping point with substitute officials, as players and coaches around the league have reached their breaking point.

A muddy affair with cyclo-cross

New England is a hub for the bike racing discipline, in which racers ride road-style bikes on off-road courses seeded with barriers, sand pits, and mud.

Square Inc. aims for expansion

Twitter Inc. cofounder Jack Dorsey came to Cambridge on Monday to recruit a few MIT graduates to help him grow his mobile payments company.

NorthPoint project making a splash

Iran test-fires missiles designed to hit warships

Over 30 nations took part in a drill responding to sea-mine attacks in international waters. During the exercise, four Iranian missiles were fired simultaneously and hit a "big target."
